Source.Name: partitionmanager
Source.Description: KDE Partition Manager allows you to manage your disks, partitions, and file systems. It can create, resize, delete, copy, backup, and restore partitions with a large number of supported file systems (ext2/3/4, reiserfs, NTFS, FAT32, and more).

New stable release.
Changes: - Fixed some minor bugs and small GUI inconsistencies. - Fixed a crash when adding operations to first resize extended partitions and then delete them were fixed.
Update.Name: Fatih Aşıcı

Update.Comment:
New stable release.
Changes: - A bug that made it impossible to activate or deactivate a swap file system was fixed. - An administrator's password is requested on startup so that non-KDE users can run the application... from their launcher. - The program no longer crashes when using the Oxygen style under KDE SC 4.4, or when the user clicks in the partition widget with newer g++ versions. - Updates for the partition widget are no longer disabled while applying operations. - Fixed a LibParted segmentation fault when the Linux Device Mapper is used. - Hang when no floppy is present is now worked around.
Update.Name: Fatih Aşıcı
